intro: Zeyheria kuntzei, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Brazil, Peru, and Ecuador. It is a climbing vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and hairy stems. Zeyheria kuntzei thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, although it requires careful management due to its vigorous growth habit.
